1461 Every blue dot is an NGO... posted 3 days ago by Capoditutticapi1 120 comments award share report block DataRepublican (small r) @DataRepublican • 3d @SenTomCotton @LindseyGrahamSC @joniernst @DanSullivan_AK @iamlisalogan @SKDoubleDub33 Hard to appreciate the scale of this effort. Every blue dot is a NGO.

Have you ever done one of these? https://www.colorlitelens.com/ishihara-test.html permalink parent award report block reply Hanging_Chad 13 points 3 days ago HEX: #5035D2 red: 80 green: 53 blue: 210 the color’s name is “iris” https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iris_(color) permalink parent award report block reply MasterChief 8 points 3 days ago ha gottem
I can't tell the difference myself until someone tells me what color it is. Found out the hard way when applying to the AF permalink parent award report block reply walls4america 5 points 3 days ago If it helps you feel any better, and you’re male, I heard that the majority of those colorblind are male. I’d never heard of colorblindness until I was about 7. My mom had sent my dad to the store and while there to pick up a pack of pink Charmin toilet paper. He came home with green (a color my mom detested in TP) and when she asked him why he got green, he said it looked pink to him. That was when I learned he was colorblind. So we females of the family had to remember his colorblindness in the rare times we needed him to pick up anything for us ….and wanted a certain color. (But several years later Charmin stopped making colored TP, so that solved that issue.) permalink parent award report block reply GuerillaYourDreams 8 points 3 days ago I find that very cool.
